If you're a Marketer playing the long game, then let your analytics tell your story. Your marketing annotations form a historical log book to help you spot trends and optimize your marketing strategies.

Signal Flare keeps track of your marketing activities so that you can see what is working and what is not.  We annotate your charts to show you the context behind the trends.  Easily explain the spikes and dips in your analytics and make planning your future better.

✨ 𝘼 𝙗𝙧𝙞𝙙𝙜𝙚 𝙗𝙚𝙩𝙬𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙩𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙨. ✨

All your annotations added to your charts, even when you switch tools.  Signal Flare supports Google Analytics, Amplitude, ahrefs, Semrush, Search Console, Google Trends and more.  Your marketing context travels with you to coordinate analysis between your tools.

✨ 𝘼 𝙗𝙧𝙞𝙙𝙜𝙚 𝙗𝙚𝙩𝙬𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙥𝙚𝙤𝙥𝙡𝙚. ✨

Share your notes with your team and then everyone has the same information.  Signal Flare puts your notes in front of the people who need them most.  When everyone has the same understanding, a consensus is easier to achieve.

✨ 𝘼 𝙗𝙧𝙞𝙙𝙜𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙛𝙪𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚. ✨

The best time to start a marketing log book was last year.  The next best time is today. You will thank yourself for keeping track of everything you've been doing in Signal Flare. Spot trends and learn lessons from the past.  

It's all possible when you keep your annotations in Signal Flare.

𝐅𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐬:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
✅ Shared context across all your tools with portable annotations
✅ Shared context for all team members with simple sharing
✅ Interactive Annotations: click to see details, hover to compare notes
✅ Easily organize and filter your annotations to simplify analysis of your analytics

Installation and Use:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1. Click "Add to Chrome" to install the extension

2. Click the Manage Extensions (the Puzzle Piece in your toolbar) and then Pin the Signal Flare extension to make it easy to reach on your toolbar.

3.  Press "Ctrl-Shift-F" hotkey sequence all at the same time to pop open the Signal Flare extension window.  First time users should click "Create an Account" to begin using Signal Flare.  Accounts are free, we won't ask for your credit card.  Returning users may login with their existing account.

4.  Go to your favorite Analytics Dashboard or SEO tool and begin adding your own annotations to your charts.  You'll find Signal Flare is ready and waiting for you on all your tools.

5.  Invite your teammates to your Signal Flare project and collaborate with shared annotations.


Use Case #1:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Are you a Solo Founder, or Solo Marketer?  You've got the weight of the business riding on your shoulders.  You alone manage all aspects of the marketing strategy.

It's vitally important to keep track of all the changes you make to the website, email campaigns, and paid advertising.  You're playing the long game and running many experiments.  Signal Flare lets you track of all the moving pieces so you can spot what is working or not working.  It's all done right there on your analytics dashboard.  Make simple note of your actions and see how they help over the next week, month, or year.


Use Case #2:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Are you the leader of a large marketing department?  Do you have separate teams for Paid Advertising, Social, Email, and Brand?  Using Signal Flare across all your teams means you can see everyone's actions and they can see each others.  

Collaborating on the context of your marketing makes it easier to attribute cause and effects to your teams and debug your complex marketing analytics.  Notice when a spike in traffic aligns with an Email Campaign or the Bounce Rate changed right after a major Website update.  Signal Flare makes it easy to know what to do next when you understand what you've already done.


Use Case #3:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Are you the leader of a marketing agency?  Do you have many customers and multiple long term initiatives?

Keeping your clients instantly and automatically informed of all the activities on their account will reduce their anxiety.  All in an effort to reduce client churn.

Organize your projects and mark the major milestones as annotations on their analytics dashboard.  Your weekly or monthly status report is now always visible on their charts. The client will already know just how big an impact your effort is making.  

Simply share your Signal Flare project with the client and keep them informed in real time.
